snippet: A three-story, 7,000-square-foot brick structure, now reconfigured as two residences, once served as home and studio for the fashion photographer Lillian Bassman.
abstract: Highly personalized Upper East Side carriage house that served for half a century as home, studio and muse of sorts to iconoclastic fashion photographer Lillian Bassman, has been put on the market by her heirs for $14.9 million.
lead_paragraph: A three-story, 7,000-square-foot brick structure, now reconfigured as two residences, once served as home and studio for the fashion photographer Lillian Bassman.

headline.seo: Exclusive – Storied Upper East Side Carriage House Is Listed
headline.main: The Carriage House in the Close-Up
headline.print_headline: The Carriage House In the Close-Up
